meanings.definition: Of, relating to, or resembling a phantasm; ghostly or spectral.
meanings.sent1: The haunted house had a phantasmic atmosphere that sent shivers down my spine.
meanings.sent2: The mist created a phantasmic effect, making the landscape look eerie.
meanings.sent3: The phantasmic figure in the mirror turned out to be just a trick of the light.
meanings.sent4: Her phantasmic presence seemed to float through the room, captivating everyone.
meanings.sent5: The phantasmic glow of the moonlit night cast an otherworldly beauty over the scene.

meanings.definition: Existing only in the imagination; unreal.
meanings.sent1: The unicorn was a phantasmic creature that only existed in fairy tales.
meanings.sent2: His dreams were filled with phantasmic adventures that felt more real than reality.
meanings.sent3: The idea of a flying car seemed phantasmic until it became a reality.
meanings.sent4: Her phantasmic hopes for the future kept her going through tough times.
meanings.sent5: The phantasmic world of the storybook came to life in her mind as she read.

meanings.sent1: The magician's trick created a phantasmic image that amazed the audience.
meanings.sent2: The mirage in the desert was a phantasmic oasis that disappeared as they approached.
meanings.sent3: The phantasmic of a talking cat in the movie made everyone laugh.
meanings.sent4: His promises were just phantasmic, vanishing into thin air when it was time to deliver.
meanings.sent5: The phantasmic of a parallel universe fascinated scientists and dreamers alike.
